column4: hi. I am having trouble mounting a cf card in a USB card reader. fdisk reports that it has a Linux (83) FS when it is FAT32. Gparted sees it as FAT32 correctly. I can't automount it but can manually. Any ideas, please
u can change the system id of ur disk using fdisk
yeah, but why would fdisk report differently from gparted?
probably in the partition table its marked as linux
does gparted not read the partition id?
probably gparted ignores the partition table and runs its own check for filesystems. pastebin the output of blkid to be certain that the disk is vfat
you can fix it in less than 2 minutes using fdisk
I just use "t" then 0x0C or whatever it is in fdisk?
I'll repartition it gparted then check it with fdisk
- there is 15MB unallocated that I just want to mop up
go ahead. and check what fdisk reports its system id after gparted works on it
that works now. it is reported as fat32 correctly in fdisk. thanks for help
